ABOUT CRM

WAY TO PARTNERS

CAMPAIGNS

PARTNERS

GET IN TOUCH

Cause Related Marketing

Empower Change Through Your Choices

Cause Related Marketing

Empower Change Through Your Choices

Cause Related Marketing

  • Cause marketing is a collaborative effort between businesses and charitable organizations, aimed at aligning a brand's products or services with a specific social cause. It's more than just a charity fundraising transaction, it's a purposeful brand collaboration designed to create a win-win situation for everyone involved. By incorporating cause marketing as a part of your corporate responsibility business model, we're taking steps to address important societal issues through social campaigns while delivering high-quality products to your customers. Cause marketing initiatives benefit the underserved communities in their improved living conditions, access to education, healthcare services, entrepreneurship skills and better livelihood opportunities due to the support garnered from the partnerships.

QUICK facts

64%

of Indian consumers prefer to buy from socially responsible companies
(Source: Nielsen)

72%

of consumers are more likely to stay loyal to brands that support a cause
(Source: IICA)

60%

of consumers feel connected to brands that support social causes
(Source: JWT India)

29%

Checkout donation increases AOV by upto 29%
(Source: ShoppingGives)

74%

of Indian consumers recommend brands that support social causes
(Source: MSL Group)

Sponsorship

Campaigns

Runway To Dreams

On the 90th anniversary of JRD Tata’s maiden flight, children from Smile Foundation took off on their #RunwayToDreams and enjoyed the ‘new feeling’ on their first ever flight from Delhi to Amritsar. This was followed by an airport familiarisation tour at Amritsar airport and a visit to Taj Amritsar.

Happydent Smile Please!

Happydent teamed up with Smile Foundation to help the lesser privileged children through a Cause Marketing Campaign. For every smiling selfie shared with Happydent Rs.5 was donated to Smile Foundation for the education of marginalised children.

Quaker Gift a Smile

Quaker joined hands with Smile Foundation to provide nutritious meals to the lesser privileged children studying in Mission Education centers. For each pack of Quaker bought, Quaker gifted a meal to the children of Smile Foundation.

Lay's Artwork for Heartwork

During Covid-19, the behind-the-scenes efforts of farmers, truck drivers, factory workers, retailers, and delivery executives ensured that millions of consumers continue to receive essential products every day across the country. Recognizing their dedication and commitment, Lay’s partnered with Smile Foundation to roll out a special initiative for these unsung heroes and provide hygiene kits to over 40,000 families.

Banega Swasth India with NDTV & Dettol

NDTV India, Smile Foundation and Dettol joined hands for the Banega Swasth India campaign to create a better and healthier environment for mothers and children. A ‘Swasth Kit’ was developed and distributed by Smile Foundation to support the health and hygiene needs of mothers for the first 1000 days, a time extremely crucial for both the new mother and newborn.

OPPO's House of Light

OPPO joined hands with Smile Foundation in its noble initiative of handholding the lesser privileged children. People who visited Oppo's House of Lights at Pacific Mall, Tagore Garden, New Delhi shared their stories about who has been the source of their light in their lives. For every candle lit and story shared, INR 50 was contributed towards Smile Foundation for the welfare of underserved children.

BRANDs SPEAK

Our cause-related marketing initiatives are not mere transactions; they are purposeful alliances driving both philanthropy and business growth. These collaborations embody a deep sense of responsibility and empathy, reflecting the values guiding us and our partner brands. Here, you’ll find testimonials from business representatives and individuals who have witnessed the positive outcomes of our collaborative efforts.

Ramesh VS
Co-founder 
Big Basket


These children remind us of our own childhood, and despite all the odds they are getting quality education today, learning, making friends and enjoying school. Big Basket is proud to be a part of this change and to support Smile Foundation’s Shiksha Na Ruke initiative. We have been associated with the cause for over a year and a half now and spending these special moments with these amazing kids really gets you in the festive spirit. Keep spreading smiles!

Rohit Kapoor, Marketing Director
Perfetti Van Melle India
Happydent

As a responsible corporate, Perfetti Van Melle believes in giving back to the communities where we operate and making a difference to the lives of these wonderful children by providing them better access to education. The cause coheres with Happydent’s brand proposition of adding ‘sparkling smiles’ to people’s lives. #HappydentSparklingSmile is a simple initiative at heart to ensure we are able to light up the lives of some underprivileged kids.
Tasleem Arif, Vice President & Head, R&D
Oppo

In a year that has been full of challenges, many children are deprived of technology to access online education. At OPPO India, we decided to spread the light of knowledge for these students. Through this initiative, OPPO India is providing accessible mobile technology that is now reaching out to the youngest in the country. It gives us immense pleasure to see the joy on their faces while accessing their classes through the ‘Wall of Knowledge’.
Salesh Grover
Business Head, OSL, Luxury Collections
Corneliani

We are delighted to be part of this prestigious association with Smile Foundation that has been working for various social causes across India. It is with great pleasure that we as a brand are able to contribute and extend our support for a noble cause like educating underprivileged children. Hope we succeed in helping a few to achieve their goals.
Sonam Kapoor, Bollywood Celebrity
Pernia’s Pop-Up

Pernia and I (Sonam Kapoor) wanted to do something for children this season. So we thought it would be great if I give like 50 pieces from my wardrobe and the proceeds go to Smile Foundation
Dilen Gandhi
Senior Director & Category Head – Foods of PepsiCo India
Lay’s

This association with Smile Foundation, our NGO partner, is an extension of our gesture to express sincere gratitude towards farmers, truck drivers, retailers, and all other unsung heroes. Despite facing numerous hurdles, these heroes have continued with their daily jobs relentlessly and brought joy to millions of consumers across India. Our initiative is just a small effort to thank them for their heartwork.

BRANDs SPEAK

Our cause-related marketing initiatives are not mere transactions; they are purposeful alliances driving both philanthropy and business growth. These collaborations embody a deep sense of responsibility and empathy, reflecting the values guiding us and our partner brands. Here, you’ll find testimonials from business representatives and individuals who have witnessed the positive outcomes of our collaborative efforts.

Rohit Kapoor, Marketing Director
Perfetti Van Melle India
Happydent

As a responsible corporate, Perfetti Van Melle believes in giving back to the communities where we operate and making a difference to the lives of these wonderful children by providing them better access to education. The cause coheres with Happydent’s brand proposition of adding ‘sparkling smiles’ to people’s lives. #HappydentSparklingSmile is a simple initiative at heart to ensure we are able to light up the lives of some underprivileged kids.
Tasleem Arif, Vice President & Head, R&D
Oppo

In a year that has been full of challenges, many children are deprived of technology to access online education. At OPPO India, we decided to spread the light of knowledge for these students. Through this initiative, OPPO India is providing accessible mobile technology that is now reaching out to the youngest in the country. It gives us immense pleasure to see the joy on their faces while accessing their classes through the ‘Wall of Knowledge’.
Salesh Grover

Sonam Kapoor, Bollywood Celebrity
Pernia’s Pop-Up

Pernia and I (Sonam Kapoor) wanted to do something for children this season. So we thought it would be great if I give like 50 pieces from my wardrobe and the proceeds go to Smile Foundation
Dilen Gandhi
Senior Director & Category Head – Foods of PepsiCo India
Lay’s

This association with Smile Foundation, our NGO partner, is an extension of our gesture to express sincere gratitude towards farmers, truck drivers, retailers, and all other unsung heroes. Despite facing numerous hurdles, these heroes have continued with their daily jobs relentlessly and brought joy to millions of consumers across India. Our initiative is just a small effort to thank them for their heartwork.

ABOUT SMILE FOUNDATION

Established in 2002, Smile Foundation is an Indian development organisation working for the welfare of children & their families in Education, Health, Livelihood, Women Empowerment and Disaster Response. You may support either of these causes through a Cause Related Marketing partnership with Smile. We are currently reaching out to over 15,00,000 children and families through more than 400 projects in over 2,000 remote villages and urban slums across 25 states of India.

ENQUIRY FORm

Phone

You may also write directly to Roopam Dhir at crm@smilefoundationindia.org
